reviews.title: I was so skeptical about
reviews.content: I was so skeptical about Coterie diapers because I tend to be hesitant on any product that has a heavy influencer and social media presence. I did not want to order a full month subscription to try, but I was after a clean diaper with clean ingredients so when I saw them at Whole Foods one day I decided to go ahead and give one pack a shot. As soon as I opened them, I instantly felt the difference and couldn’t believe how incredibly soft they were. The real test was of course absorbency, and they absolutely exceeded expectations. I tried them overnight, and they absorbed a full night without any leaks. I previously used Huggies which were great for absorbency, but in the morning I always noticed a very strong urine smell. Coterie absorbs just as well and does not smell! I’ve been on the subscription for the last 5 months and I will never use another diaper.

reviews.title: First time mama here. We
reviews.content:
First time mama here. We tried several different brands of diapers for our baby girl (2 months old now) and each one just did not hold up, plus they didn’t feel very soft … we switched to Coterie and couldn’t be happier. The delivery subscription is super convenient because the last thing you want on your mind as a parent is getting down to the last few diapers and needing a stressful, rushed trip to the store for more. 

The convenience of having the diaper (and wipes) delivered monthly or sooner if needed can’t be beat. 

Plus my baby hates the car and car rides are so dreaded that for the price of the diapers and wipes to get delivered AND I don’t have to take a screaming baby into the store, completely worth it for my babies comfort.

Definitely committed to sticking with Coterie diapers for this sweet little one and our little ones to come!

reviews.title: These diapers are fantastic! If
reviews.content:
These diapers are fantastic! If you haven't tried them, you need to!! I tried Kudos and Everylife. . . I vote Everylife over the Kudos, Kudos always left a mark near the hip bone, even when the diaper was loose, like it was rubbing/cutting into the skin. Everylife was great however their sizes run small and my son grew out of them 13 months. Neither of these brands are as soft or absorbent as Coterie. I could have saved a lot of sheet washing if I got these sooner for my oldest baby.

I've only been using them a couple of months, I have a new born and an 18 month. 

At first I was disappointed with the website because I kept having issues with the ordering process, literally every time I placed an order, which was on auto renewal. I finally sent in an email inquiry to learn what was going on. 

Jeff replied and Jeff was zero help. It was obvious that he didn't take time to look at my account. Jeff gaslit the situation. (The situation: my order was set to go out on Aug 18. I received email communication about, all seemed well. It was now 8 days after my order was supposed to ship, I had not received any shipping info yet and was almost out of diapers. Even though it was 8 days later, my account online still showed that my next ship date of Aug 18. . . I took a screenshot of this on the 26th because it seemed odd) 

Jeff replied to the email stating that my account says the order is set for Aug 27, which was the very next day. He stated that he saw no issues and asked is there anything else he can help with.

I emailed back, expressed my concerns and sent in screenshots. Then I heard back from Kim. Thank God for Kim. Kim is GREAT!!

Kim wrote back and said that she did in fact find a weird glitch with my account. There was something with the payment that wouldn't go through. I never received a "card declined" email because it had nothing to do with my card, it was something on the back end with their system. 

Kim fixed the issue and even provided a discount so that I could buy a few diapers from a local store in the meantime. Kim, you deserve a raise. You made me feel heard and brought clarity to a frustrating situation.

I love these diapers and wipes. Kim, you made me fall in love with the company even more. Thank you so much for your time and your help. I will be ordering from this company until my babies are potty trained.

reviews.title: I love your diapers. They
reviews.content:
I love your diapers. They are soft and gentle. They are almost like fabric rather then typical diaper. They are super absorbent. They also are thin and flexible so my grandson can move comfortably.
Another bonus is that they are made with clean, hypoallergenic materials so no harsh chemicals or dyes to irritate his skin. 
I love the fact that there is a wetness indicator which makes it easy to know when it's time for a change. He is over 3 months now and as far as I know he has not had one diaper rash.
I am the grandma and wanted to help out and placed an order to be sent to their home. Apparently there was a back order. The company reimbursed my money in full and made sure they still received the order. I was totally amazed.
Overall I feel Coterie is a premium diaper that prioritizes both bay comfort and parent's convenience. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.title: I recently ordered Coterie diapers
reviews.content:
I recently ordered Coterie diapers for both my newborn and my 2-year-old daughter, and I have to say—this product is amazing. In my opinion, it's the best diaper on the market. It feels like the cleanest, most protective, and healthiest option available, which gives me real peace of mind as a parent.

The quality is truly outstanding—from the softness to the absorbency, everything feels premium and gentle on my babies' skin. I’ve noticed fewer leaks and no irritation, which is a huge relief.

That said, the price is quite high—almost a dollar per diaper—which unfortunately makes it hard for me to afford consistently. I really wish I could continue using Coterie long-term, because it’s hands down the best diaper I’ve tried.

Also, I’d love to know if you have any programs for parents who are open to sharing photos and helping with marketing in exchange for product. That would be amazing, and I’d be more than happy to help spread the word about a product I genuinely love.

Thank you for creating such a thoughtful, high-quality diaper!

Aside from that, the durability, feel, and performance of these diapers are excellent. I would recommend giving them a try!

Coterie though has wowed me and I will never buy another brand of diapers if it can be helped. reviews.title: Title: Great for Absorbency and
reviews.content:
Title: Great for Absorbency and Comfort — But Not Reliable for Blowouts (3 Stars)

My son is 8 months old and has been using Coterie diapers since birth. Overall, they’re some of the softest and most absorbent diapers we’ve tried—and I plan to continue using them until I’m ready to switch to cloth diapers.

The pros:

Incredibly soft and gentle on his skin

Excellent absorbency for urine — they hold for long stretches, even overnight

No leaks with pee, even during naps or long car rides

But the cons are significant—especially when it comes to blowouts. These diapers just don’t contain liquid poop well, particularly with an exclusively breastfed baby. We’ve had multiple major blowouts, including one where I ended up throwing away an entire outfit because the mess went all the way down the leg and I didn’t realize it.

The worst incident happened while we were outside in a rural area on a cold day. My son had on a double-zippered outfit, and I unzipped only from the bottom to change his diaper—not knowing the mess had traveled up. I didn’t have backup wipes or a clean outfit with me. My options were to either force the dirty outfit back over his body, covering him in poop again, or break the zipper to get him out without making things worse. I chose to break the zipper.

I’m giving 3 stars because I do appreciate the comfort and excellent pee protection, and I’ll keep using them for now. But at this price, I expected better blowout protection. These diapers are not reliable in that department—and that matters, especially during unpredictable moments when you can’t afford a cleanup emergency.

reviews.content: These are the best diapers we have tried so far, and we’ve tried at least 7 different types! We’ve used Coterie diapers in size newborn and size 1 so far. We find that they fit our baby really well and are one of the easier diaper types to get on and off. They are soft and hold a lot of liquid, making them great for overnight. The back of the diaper goes up pretty high and has a scrunched part at the back. These with blowouts, but we have had a few poop leaks up the back when baby was napping. It seems only a few diapers have the blowout barrier flap built in, but I wish these had that! These are pricier than most diapers but we think they are actually worth the higher price!

reviews.title: Every wipe I have brought
reviews.content: Every wipe I have brought from Coterie has been true to size. I leave it overnight for 10 hours and no leakage, so great coverage. I only change baby to potentially wake her up if there is poop. She gets no rash! I've tried multiple diapers including competitors like healthy baby, and the problem I run is not being true to size so frequent blow outs or the material feels flimsy, subpar in comparison. I just love the soft texture. My baby is currently 5 1/2 months at 16 lbs and 10 oz. She uses a size 3. An extra aspect of Coterie thats amazing however is the easiness of ordering on a monthly basis. You get access via txt msg and they have 6 options to choose from. Right now I have two diaper packages left and they notified me 5 days in advance that a shipment will be sent out and I responded with DELAY. They confirm the delayed shipment and specifically stated it will be delayed by one week which is perfect. If i want to change the diaper size, you say SIZE. If you need to be shipped before the 5 days then you say NOW. Now tell me that doesn't make the process of buying a diaper so much easier!

reviews.title: Sometimes you read reviews where
reviews.content:
Sometimes you read reviews where people say 'this product is all influencer hype and branding. it doesnt actually work like it claims to. ' I typically ignore those comments as they could easily be written by competitor brands. 

However, in this case, I would like to say that this product is all influencer hype and branding and it doesnt actually work like it claims to. Based on how the product is marketed, its primary selling point is how it is more absorbent than other diapers and it will allow baby to sleep longer. This is not true at all. We had daily leaks requiring us to change the bedding constantly. 

If the main selling point was the ingredients, we'd understand. We are all for clean materials and so we would support this diaper. However, this product is (IMO misleadingly) marketed as having high absorbency and maximizing baby's sleep. We switched brands and have had zero leaks or blowouts. 

The Coterie diaper does not justify being more than double the price of another household brand. Doubt we will be repurchasing.

reviews.title: After reading numerous positive reviews,
reviews.content:
After reading numerous positive reviews, I was excited to try Coterie diapers for my 6-month-old baby. I ordered Size 3 and have been using them consistently for the past three weeks.

Unfortunately, I’ve experienced multiple leakage incidents—both urine and dirty diaper leaks—even though I’ve been putting them on carefully and comfortably. I’ve followed the fit instructions and even watched videos to ensure I’m using them correctly, but the issues persist.

I truly wanted to love these diapers given the brand’s reputation and premium positioning, but this has been quite disappointing. I hope you’ll take this feedback into consideration, and I’d appreciate any advice or support you can provide to help resolve this issue.

reviews.title: My son is autistic and
reviews.content: My son is autistic and has some tactile sensitivities. He found his previous diapers too “itchy” and they drove him nuts. The Coterie diapers are very soft on the skin and I love that about them. Unfortunately my son still occasionally finds them itchy if he had an overwhelming day and he’s feeling more sensitive. One other thing I noticed is that I can hear him peeing in the diaper and if he’s laying down, the pee drips to the back before it gets absorbed whereas the Huggies ones seems to absorb everything mostly where the pee hits. I’m not sure if his bum is a little too skinny for these diapers or if there’s just a bit too much pee when we’re using these over night but I have had multiple occasions where there were leaks around the bum when he’s getting up in the morning. I’m a little disappointed with the leaking, but despite the occasional complaints about itchiness this is far softer and seemingly more comfortable than our usual options.

reviews.title: I transitioned my son into
reviews.content:
I transitioned my son into size 3 when he was 2 months old and probably just under 13 pounds - under the suggested 14lb weight size for these. My son is long and lean, if that matters. 

The size 2 diapers kept leaking poop out of the sides, but once we switched to size 3, no problems. 

Unlike size 1 and 2, size 3 looks like they’ll last quite a while! 

Like all coterie diapers, these are amazingly absorbent. My son has never had diaper rash and has never complained because of being uncomfortable in his diaper. Maybe that’s just his personality, or maybe it’s the softness and moisture-wicking properties keeping him dry… I don’t know, and I don’t care. It’s working and I’m not changing it!

reviews.title: I’ve been using Coterie diapers
reviews.content:
I’ve been using Coterie diapers for a few months now, and they’ve been absolutely worth it. The first thing I noticed was how incredibly soft they are—noticeably different from other brands I’ve tried. They feel clean and breathable, not plasticky or overly scented, which I really appreciate.

Most importantly, they’ve been consistently gentle on my baby’s skin. We’ve had zero issues with rashes, redness, or irritation, even with overnight use. The fit is great, and leaks have been rare. It’s a bit more expensive than drugstore options, but the quality really does make a difference. Highly recommend if you're looking for something gentle and effective.

reviews.title: I had high expectations for
reviews.content:
I had high expectations for the Coterie diapers, but unfortunately, they didn’t meet them. I ordered sizes N and 1 for my baby, who was 7 pounds when we brought her home. The size N was quite big for her at first, and I struggled for weeks until she gained some weight, making the fit a bit better (she wasn’t preterm).

The biggest issue I faced was the diapers leaking urine. At first, I thought I had touched something wet, but it turned out the pee was leaking, especially from the belly area. This happened 4–5 times, which was really frustrating. On the positive side, the diapers were excellent at containing stool with no leaks in that regard.

I liked the wipes, but I’m not happy with the diapers. I’m still searching for the best diaper for my baby.

reviews.title: I recently tried this diaper,
reviews.content:
I recently tried this diaper, and I have to say, it’s a game-changer! First off, the fit is perfect—it’s bigger, giving my little one more room to move around comfortably. The absorbency is impressive too; even after hours of use, it stays dry and doesn’t leak, which is such a relief during naps and overnight.

What really sets this diaper apart, though, is that it’s made without chemicals. As a parent, knowing that it’s safe and clean for my baby’s delicate skin gives me peace of mind. No harsh chemicals or fragrances, just a natural, gentle material that I trust for my baby. Overall, I’m really happy with this diaper and would definitely recommend it to other parents looking for something reliable and safe!

reviews.title: We’ve used Coterie diapers and
reviews.content: We’ve used Coterie diapers and products with all three of our kiddos and have zero complaints. The diapers are strong but soft, have fantastic range of motion, and all sizes have worked through the various stages. We happily switched to the pull up pants once those came available, but we still use the diapers for the baby stages. We love the simple white design (no pattern showing through clothes!) and the material is so comfortable for our kids. Despite sensitive skin issues, we’ve never had any rashes with Coterie products. And the absorbency is too-notch! No overnight or long day concerns, and even blowouts have been well-captured, minimizing clean up afterward. We have found the price very reasonable for such an excellent non-toxic product, particularly compared to other leading brands.

reviews.content: Unfortunately, these are not as magical as I hoped they would be. I've been using Coterie since my baby was a newborn (she's currently 6 months/ ~16lb). I love the ingredients and the feel of the diapers however, ""12 hour leak protection"" has not been my experience-- especially in the past couple months. She was growing out of the size two and her pee would come out the back every night. We have sized up thinking that would solve the issue however now with size 3 her pee is coming out the sides. I've resorted to changing her diaper when she wakes up for her middle of the night feed to avoid waking up to pee soaked PJ's and sleep sacks. The price for these is way too high to have to do the same thing I could be doing with a much less expensive diaper.

reviews.content: While they are soft diapers/absorbent diapers, I just don’t think it’s feasible to keep on buying them. The back scrunch of the diaper is minimal which is probably why so many blowouts/leaks happen with so many people myself included and I’ve never had any issues prior with other brands. I’m giving it another shot and ordering the next size up, because in my opinion they do run a little small. But, I really don’t see myself to continue to purchase these. I really hate they don’t offer samples (like a 2-3pack. ) You HAVE to subscribe and see up reoccurring shipments. I hate how smaller packs aren’t available in stores (at least in my location) so you have to wait for shipment to finally arrive and trying to do that around the holidays another level of crazy. reviews.content: Wonderful diapers! Highly recommend! NO rashes and they are nice and soft on my baby girl's new sensitive skin. reviews.title: Overall I was pretty impressed.
reviews.content:
Overall I was pretty impressed. First, the softness of these diapers is amazing! They feel really gentle against my baby’s skin, which is a huge plus. Absorbency is also excellent for the most part—Coterie diapers held up well even through naps and active play without any leaks.

However, I did notice that during longer stretches they did leak/soak through the back not the sides. Just something to be mindful of if you are pushing it. 

The wipes were great as well. They were durable and gentle on my babies skin. The container that they came in were easy to use and easy to close even with one hand. I really liked them. 
In summary, Coterie diapers are soft, comfortable, and generally very absorbent. They are a little bit pricier than what we normally buy but would definitely continue using them.

These diapers have zero designs on them, which I like because you know there are no dies being used. They are so soft on the inside and the outside that I have no doubt they are more comfortable for him to wear.

reviews.title: We received our first Coterie
reviews.content: We received our first Coterie diapers as a gift to try as a potential option for a gluten free diaper solution (I have celiac, the momma). We tried several brands and Coterie had the best fit and absorption, and they're super soft! We started with NB and signed up for a subscription with size 1 and are now at size 2. The numbers have coordinated with our son's age which is great and he seems to be very comfortable in them. No diaper rash and I'm happy to have an option that won't make me sick too! Most diapers I found had a wheat core, for me this was a no as I could react if the gluten became airborne and since we live in a 100% gluten free home. The pricing is a little higher than average, but worth it for comfort all around, less leakage, and it really doesn't break the bank. These fit our lifestyle well, thank you, Coterie!

reviews.title: We purchased a sample pack
reviews.content: We purchased a sample pack of 4 different brand of diapers from Babylist while we were expecting, and even tried 2 other brands as well. Hands down Coterie was the most comfortable for our babe, absorbed liquid the best, and to this day has not left rashes or red marks or indents on his body. While the price tag is a little higher than other brands, it’s 100% worth it. Customer service has been really helpful, being able to real time text with someone immediately is so great and their diapers come lightning quick. The wipes are also thicker and bigger than other brands of wipes. 10/10 recommend!

reviews.title: Are they significantly more expensive
reviews.content:
Are they significantly more expensive than other diapers? Yes. Are they worth it if you can find room in your budget? Also yes. Higher cost per diaper is offset by the need to use fewer diapers. Significantly reduced laundry burden from blowouts and overnight leak through, as these are exceedingly rare with this diaper. Moisture associated skin irritation, which had been challenging with all other diapers we tried, has basically ceased to be a problem. 

Cost is the only reason for 4 stars instead of 5.

reviews.title: I have tried every “clean”
reviews.content: I have tried every “clean” or “cleaner” diaper on the market and keep coming back to this one. With this diaper I have experienced the least amount of leaks/blowouts and have had to use little to no diaper cream since switching solely to Coterie. I appreciate not having a pattern so there isn’t undergarment images showing through the baby’s clothes. Though, if this important to you, just know the Coterie label on the front will likely show through, but this is minimal compared to other diapers. While, I wish the diaper didn’t contain polyesters the positives outweigh this too much not to use because of it. The moisture wicking/absorption has led to rarely needing diaper cream (like maybe once every 2-3 weeks). Other clean diapers don’t wick enough perhaps because they use cotton and not polyester. Once you are already spending the money for a “clean” diaper the less than 0. 10 more to use Coterie is worth it.

reviews.title: Love the purity and quality
reviews.content: Love the purity and quality

reviews.title: I really, really like Coterie’s
reviews.content:
I really, really like Coterie’s diapers. They are very soft inside and out. Once you go with one of these new, soft diapers, it’s hard to switch back to any other brand. 

We’ve tried Kudos, but they feel stiff and plastic like. Mille Moon is very soft, but they left my infant’s skin quite damp - even with a small amount of liquid. Not to mention - the recent reviews that mention chemical burns have scared me a bit. 

Coterie diapers are incredibly absorbent - my 2. 5 month old can go through 1-3 nursings at night without a diaper change and wake up with her skin mostly dry (no other diaper we have tried does this!)! With my older 3 boys, we had diaper rash from overnight wetness on the regular (do NOT use Target brand overnight - that’s just misery for a sweet kiddo!). My little girl hasn’t had any issues with skin irritation and I don’t anticipate rash from wet diapers if we keep up with Coterie. The only sort of downside I could imagine with this brand is that they are a bit bulkier than any other diaper I’ve used, but not at all like cloth and the pluses give reason to the bulk (softness and absorbency). 

There is one other competitor that is even softer, thinner and apparently even more “natural” that I really like - but her skin is a tiny bit more damp when I change her (but still less so than with many of the other brands). That one can be ordered from Target in smaller amounts, so I’ll probably keep those as a filler or will stock up on when there are sales. 

Coterie truly does make an amazing diaper that I believe is better for baby (in terms of ingredients and that they truly keep baby’s skin clean and dry), but of course like any other item - you will pay for it. I’m making it work by choosing not to buy things new with this baby and only use hand me down clothes and what not. If I have to cut costs, then so be it but for now - the bulk of our baby spending money will go towards these awesome diapers!

reviews.title: We love these diapers! We
reviews.content: We love these diapers! We had a rough start having to go to the NICU and my baby got a gnarly diaper rash from the premie size pampers that they put him in (he was not premie, but was too small for the Newborn size yet at 6lbs 11oz). We switched him to the newborn Honest diapers after that because he was still too small for the Coterie Newborn, and those had numerous pee and poo blow outs. Once he grew into the Coterie newborn size the diaper rash improved significantly (and maybe wouldnt have been an issue if we had been able to use Coterie from the start--hopefully they will make a premie size bc the Newborn size took almost a month for him to fit) and we've had less blowouts. Also the customer service can't be beat, super responsive team of real people, not automated responses.

reviews.content: best diaper ever!! so soft, no diaper rashes, super absorbent!! no complaints from us!!

reviews.title: An absolute game changer for
reviews.content: An absolute game changer for my baby. Blowout proof and leak proof to help her stay comfortable and sleep through the night!! We went from getting 3-4 hour stretches to 7-8, and she only wakes to feed, not because she’s wet! They’re also insanely soft so they don’t dig or leave marks!

reviews.title: Love these so much! They
reviews.content: Love these so much! They were incredibly helpful with sleep training because I knew he was comfortable and never once has he leaked through to his pajamas while wearing these. Total game changer!

reviews.title: Pros: Feels dryer to my
reviews.content:
Pros:
Feels dryer to my touch than Pampers, Pampers Pure, Honest and Dyper. I believe it feels dryer to my baby’s touch too: I notice than my baby no longer fusses to ask to change diapers (4 months old). She used to let us know right away after urinating since birth.

Good wide fit to envelop baby’s buttocks.

Cons:
Not blowout prof or leak proof, but I don’t think any diapers are depending on baby’s position and milk intake.
It lasts through the night IF baby doesn’t wake up to feed or sometimes would last if she feeds/snacks only once. As a rule of thumb we change the diaper after 2 night feeds (including one before she goes to sleep as she feeds right before going to bed - not ideal but that’s what she asks for - ). Otherwise it has leaked for us every time, again, I think it is reasonable performance you reasonable expect the diaper to last through 4 feeds 

Feels softer although the outer part is softer than the inside part (where it touches baby’s skin). Wish it was the other way around.

Wish it was more carbon neutral. We might try Happy Baby to compare a more environmental friendly in the similar price range. 
—-/-/-/-/-/——

Overall satisfied with Coterie, but want to make sure the diaper is as good as their marketing is. (What a brilliant idea to market diapers for sleep!! Should be a Marketing case for MBAs)

reviews.content: I absolutely love these diapers and they are 100% worth it! They are so soft, hold a lot, and my little guy never gets diaper rashes. The convenience of having them delivered to our doorstep is amazing especially as a family with a new baby. The wipes are a must too, so soft and a great size. If you are unsure of size, try some trial packs first. We went with size three when my little guy was just over 14 pounds and they just didn’t fit right. He’s in size two still at about 16. 5 pounds and the only time we have leakage is if he moves around in his sleep a lot and the diaper moves a bit. Before using these, we were having blowouts and leaks multiple times a day. Would recommend to anyone and everyone!

Jeanette

reviews.title: I purchased one month of
reviews.content:
I purchased one month of Coterie size 1 because my newborn was in-between NB & 1 with all the grocery store brands, when I read that coterie’s 1 is a big smaller (not a bad thing — the size gap is massive with Huggies & Pampers), and I was able to find a discount, so I went for it. And my word, if these diapers were even remotely more affordable, these would be our forever brand. They are so much softer and more absorbent and just all around nicer. And you don’t see that weird external dampness like you do with the others. But alas, maternity leave pay does not leave one with premium diaper dollars so it’s back to bulk Huggies for us. 

I will make one suggestion —- I assume Huggies’ blowout band parent has expired…. yall gotta get that !

reviews.title: I wanted to fall in
reviews.content:
I wanted to fall in love. And maybe if my baby was not a toddler I would have. These diapers are so so so soft and seem like they would be comfortable. They also do a pretty darn good job of wicking away wetness and my little one is a heavy wetter. 

As much as I wanted to fall head over heels though, we had a few wetness leaks and poopy almost-blowouts. We even tried the next size up thanks to the generous sample sent by Coterie. 

If you’re on the fence, give them a try! No diaper rash, great wicking ability, soft and eco friendly.

reviews.title: Love this brand! We will
reviews.content: Love this brand! We will not use any other diaper. We love that they are soft, non-fragranced, non toxic, and really absorbent. Our baby was in the NICU for 1 month, in the beginning, she was using their diaper that was fragranced. She had a diaper rash in less than a week from the other brand. We brought our coterie diapers to NICU and she hasn’t had a diaper rash since! Also with the other brand, she was constantly having blowouts. Since we switched diapers, she hasn’t had any full on blowouts… Only a few poop ‘leaks’ during our 6 weeks of use and I believe it was user error of us not having the ruffles out around the leg or not tight enough at the waist. Our daughter sleeps 10-12 hours over night and the diaper can handle that. She has a full pee diaper every morning with no leaks. If she fusses during the night I will change her, otherwise the diaper keeps her dry enough for her to sleep really well. We love the wipes too. We have tried a few different wipes because of gifts. However, I keep coming back to these. I don’t want to run out! And I don’t even want to finish up using the other gifted wipes! These are thick, wet, and larger. I can use 1-2 wipes per poop. Our daughter is 8 weeks old and in size 1. We did use a full 6 pack of NB when she was born at 6lbs 6oz before switching to size 1. These are premium for a reason. Worth the cost. And, you won’t need to buy diaper cream!

reviews.title: I have a newborn in
reviews.content: I have a newborn in diapers and a toddler in pull-ups and Coteri is by far my favorite brand. They are soft and offer full coverage. They both have the line down the middle to indicate wetness and I prefer the plain white diaper design compared to the graphic cartoon designs available on other brands. Knowing my babies are safe from toxins is the main reason for my subscription and my babes have been clear from any skin irritation since using Coterie.

reviews.content: These diapers are by far the softest brand that we’ve tried. We are on the hunt for a blowout resistant diaper and have tried tons of brands in the 5 months of having our baby. reviews.title: The texture is very soft,
reviews.content:
The texture is very soft, we used this when she was younger but found the pee line to not be as obvious, at the time we didn’t see a noticeable difference with Coterie and Huggies and felt the coverage was better with Huggies so we switched back.

However, my daughter is a bit older now (15 months) and she had a really bad diaper rash case recently. We tried all types of diaper cream but found that switching back to coterie also seemed to help her redness a lot. She leaks a bit more wearing coterie than Huggies but her skin is considerably better so we’re going to stick with it again.

reviews.title: These diapers can definitely hold
reviews.content: These diapers can definitely hold a lot of liquid waste, while still keeping diaper rashes and discomfort at bay! We have been able to cut our diaper usage down by about a third, which ends up making them cheaper than others. We were changing diapers 7-10 times per day and we now change her 3-5 times per day. They are extremely soft and seem to very comfortable for my little, so much so, I have to be proactive about changing her diaper because she rarely fusses about it anymore! The only concern I have is that the liquid waste smell is extremely apparent. I attribute this to the fact that the diapers are TCF and fragrance free, so meh!

reviews.title: So, for my Baby Shower,
reviews.content:
So, for my Baby Shower, we got a package of size 1 diapers of the following brands: Millies, Pampers, Huggies, Dyaper and Coterie. From the start, Millies, Dyaper and Coterie felt a lot more luxurious. However, as the baby was becoming harder to change during the night (he cries a lot when woken for a diaper change), the need for a really absorbent diaper became apparent.

Dyaper and Coterie were best. But in an attemot to get something cheaper, however, high up in the low-tox spec, we went with a totally new brand given that we had received a sample. Parasol: Cute, and comfy but man, they always spill my baby's urine. 

Fast forward today, we decided to go with a subscription of Coterie, as much as it might appear more expensive than the others. You will end up with less soiled baby clothes and doing laundry less often, so it is the choice to go with.

Despite all of the planning, things happen…

With that said, we still preferred coterie because we think our daughter’s sensitive skin reacted least with Coterie, her diaper rash disappeared and has not re-appeared. The blowouts don’t happen all of the time, and would occur with any diaper brand.

I recommend coterie as the next best thing to cloth diapers. It’s also a nice add on that the diapers do not have designs. Keep that.

I plan on trying the next size up to see if that helps, but in all I do notice far fewer leaks which makes these diapers worth it, especially overnight, in my opinion. My daughter sleeps more soundly in them, which is really all that I can ask for as it’s her comfort that we care most about. I also like that they’re not covered in patterns, so it doesn’t show through any of her lighter colored clothing. The ease of a subscription service is also really nice and I no longer worry about running out of diapers.

reviews.title: I absolutely love the coterie
reviews.content: I absolutely love the coterie brand diapers. For the first year of my daughters life her grandparents wanted to buy her diapers because they knew they wouldn’t see her a lot and wanted to help contribute to the arguably the most trying year of being a parent. After some research on diaper subscriptions and also realizing we had a little one with a sensitive bum… we landed here! While the price is a little higher than the average diapers on shelf, in my opinion it’s completely worth it. It ships right to my door with a months supply that usually always takes me 1 pack or close into the next month always leaving me with some security in case of shipping delays. My daughter is 30inches long now and almost 24lb. We are currently wearing a size 6. After the year was up we countinued our subscription on our own because of the leak protection alone. We had tried other diapers here and there that we were gifted from our shower. Nothing held up like coterie. My boyfriend did a cup test. Haha, men and their experiments. Most all other cups held one-one and a half solo cups while coterie held twice that. They feel so soft and the texture on the outside is gentle and not irritating at all. As a Mama who loves her sleep (who doesn’t!?) I love that my daughter who pees more over night stays dry all night long so she can get her much needed toddler rest too! Excited to see how the pants work for us in the future!

We are so grateful for the extra sleep, the fast and easy shipping and the superior quality that Coterie has to offer. Consider me a believer!

reviews.content: So far we love our diapers. I was reluctant to try them initially because of the price point. reviews.content: Soft, gentle on her skin, very absorbent. Since changing to Coterie, her diaper rash is gone, sleeping better, and less soaking through her clothes.

reviews.title: These diapers are certainly softer
reviews.content: These diapers are certainly softer than some of the leading brands (i.e. Pampers or Huggies). The tabs are sturdy and also hold much better, something that will come in handy for older babies. Because of the softer material, the diaper leaves fewer impressions on my baby's thighs, hips, and private areas, which makes for a happier baby during and before diaper changes. Where Coterie does not exceed Pampers in quality is their ability to prevent leaks. My daughter sleeps for 9-12 hours a night and we've had a few instances of minor leaks in the morning when the diaper is too saturated. We had the same issue with Pampers, so the material does not appear to be more or less absorbent than what we had before. Overall, I am satisfied with the product.

reviews.content:
Feel
Nice, but leak through the fabric if they urinate too much and the diapers definitely do not work as overnights. I liked the idea of a subscription because it is easier with my twin boys. The material is not irritating. One diaper unraveled but most were made very well. We tried the 4, which did not hold enough urine or feces, & the 5 are too large so the diapers sag and leak via the sides. One twin is also very good at getting these diapers off. Better than competing bougie brands, but we are going back to what didn’t leak.

reviews.title: Coterie diapers are truly amazing!
reviews.content:
Coterie diapers are truly amazing! They are insanely absorbent, and are perfect for overnight. First, the materials used are so quality, soft and quiet, not full of noisy plastic. My baby has been able to sleep undisturbed since he was two months old because of these diapers.
I see a lot of reviews about these diapers being expensive, however, I am able to use less diapers because my baby stays dry and comfortable for hours. I'm buying less, using less and throwing away less. 
When I was using lower quality brands I would be changing diapers constantly and had an overflowing diaper pail. Now my baby is clean and dry and I'm not adding to the landfill.

reviews.title: New mama here. Before having
reviews.content:
New mama here. Before having a kiddo I was adamant that I wouldn’t be one of ‘those’ moms that throws money around on luxury or designer baby things… FYI, I still don’t. 

That said, trying Coterie was the absolute best decision I made. Price wise, they are comparable to Huggies and Pampers, but in terms of quality and dependability they are not even on the same playing field. From the day I put my daughter in Coterie diapers, I saw a significant decrease in blowouts and leaks. I went from changing sheets and outfits almost daily to trusting that my baby can sleep through the night and be dry in the morning. 

Some things are worth spending a little extra money on. This is one of those things. 

Also, I’d been buying my diapers at Whole Foods and was hesitant to use the automated delivery process on the website. To my surprise, the automated system is actually very user friendly and the text assistant is great! 

My advice to parents: give Coterie a chance. It worked wonders for me, maybe it will workout for you too.

reviews.title: We are die hard Coterie

Plus, my baby has had diaper rash exactly one time when using Coterie (when he slept for 9 hours straight for the first time), but almost immediately got it when using the other brands. For that reason alone (my baby’s comfort - one less reason he’d be fussy), it’s worth the extra cost to us.

reviews.title: Coterie diapers have been a
reviews.content: Coterie diapers have been a lifesaver. Our baby was premature and started out in Pampers premies at the hospital. He developed a diaper rash, and when we came home, we could not get it cleared up despite frequent changing. We tried a number of different brands, none of which would keep him dry. We eventually tried Coterie, and we have been so impressed. He no longer has any diaper rash, and his skin stays dry. Another pro - I love that there are no designs or prints on the diapers. A few cons - cost being the main one, although I will continue to order Coterie diapers because we have been so happy. Ordering diapers is a breeze, but I wish I could order a smaller or larger amount of diapers rather than a one months supply. While it is apparently easy to exchange sizes (we have not done this) according to other reviews, it takes away from the convenience of just having these delivered to your door. Overall, however, I give these diapers a 10/10 and will keep my baby in them.

reviews.title: This is the softest disposal
reviews.content: This is the softest disposal diaper we’ve tried!!! … and we’ve tried them all on our third child. All three of my children have had sensitive skin- we deal with lots of rashes and the diapers can make or break the issue. My pediatrician recommended we switch to cloth diapers, so in a last ditch effort we tried Coterie. It has been a complete reversal for my 16mo yr old. He was constantly struggling with rashes, it didn’t matter how much I applied cream, aquaphor, etc… and when I switched to coterie it stopped!! I should mention we also switched to their wipes- they’re incredible! I’ve used all the wipes you can imagine and I’m picky. Their wipes are larger than competitors, they’re thicker, and they stay damp longer (it could be a better locking mechanism on their wipe pack or maybe just more liquid added I’m not sure). Also the coterie wipes come out easier, like one wipe at a time vs other wipes that come out in multiples - causing you to usually use more wipes. I’ve been really impressed with this company and for our family it’s been a lifesaver. Thank you!

reviews.content: There are things I love about these diapers and a handful of things I don’t like. I love how soft they are on my sons sensitive skin, the quality of the diaper, and how easy they are to put on securely. However, the absorbency isn’t drastically better that my son notices. He still fusses the moment he pees and I still change diapers at the same frequency as other brands. This means I run out of diapers after 2-3 weeks instead of 4 weeks. The sizing is also on the smaller end that my son grows out of the diaper at the third week. This happened with both the size 1 and 2 whereas his pampers last 4-5 weeks in those sizes. So he tends to blow out of them more out the back and legs. I may likely discontinue since the negatives are starting to outweigh the positives.

reviews.title: I have always been a
reviews.content: I have always been a Huggies mom, then I read more into the ingredients and chemicals and wanted something cleaner for my baby’s skin. I tried a few other bamboo brands that were so scratchy… I finally splurged and signed up for Coterie subscription. The diapers fit better than any other brand, they are soft, they absorb more than any other diaper I’ve tried - and the subscription part actually has been super convenient. You can text to skip a month or to size up and get notifications when it’s coming up, so it’s honestly one less thing I have to remember to do and I know now that I’ll never have to run to the store or remind myself to buy on Amazon anymore. They also give you a trial pack of 5 diapers in the next size up so you know when your baby is ready for the next size. The cost isn’t much different once you really pencil it out and the little bit each month is totally worth it for the clean ingredients alone, but also for the comfort and the feel and the coverage knowing baby is good and my brain is less busy!

reviews.content:
These diapers are the only brand you’ll need. We went through 4 (Millie Moon, Pampers, 7th generation, Honest) of the leading brand names and Coterie is the only that would truly protect from blowouts, scoot outs, or pee outs, any other out’s. You can definitely go a full night without changing the diaper. The best decision we made was ordering the trial of Coterie. They are softer, have more coverage, and have clean ingredients! 

p. s. - if you forget to pull out the little little fringes near the legs (as with any diaper) there will be some leakage. But even that leakage was less than others!

reviews.content: Honestly I gave these diapers a second chance and am so glad I did! I got them in the Babylist diaper box but they were a size one which weren’t wide enough for my baby. reviews.content: I love how soft and absorbent this diaper is, the one thing we’ve seriously struggled with is blowouts up the back. Being a new parent I thought in my sleep deprived state I was doing something wrong. But it really doesn’t matter how snug the diaper is at the waist, it still happens much too frequently for my tastes. After trying two other brands I noticed they have a kind of flap on the back portion that acts as a damn for babies that excel at forceful pooping, which almost always prevents a poo-splosion. Hopefully, in the not too distant future, Coterie will consider adding this to their design, as I think it could bring this diaper from three stars to five stars.

reviews.title: We have been super happy
reviews.content: We have been super happy with this diaper which outperforms all others we tried. I originally was hesitant because I wanted the most eco friendly disposable I could find and other brands appeared to fit that bill better. But when I did a closer inspection of what was actually in all the diapers, the only difference I could find was that the most stringently eco ones use a ""plant based"" plastic and coterie doesn't. The core ingredients that make up the bulk of the diaper are just as sustainable with Coterie, and the performance is so much better-- they just don't leak and they are soft against baby's skin! We were hesitant to spend the money, since there are plenty of cheaper diapers out there but you really do get what you pay for. We are hooked.

Ever.

reviews.title: I was really close to
reviews.content:

She was blowing out every single time we took a drive somewhere in her old diapers and we’ve gone through a month’s supply of these and haven’t had a single blowout. Definitely worth the hype!

reviews.title: I’ve heard rave reviews about
reviews.content:
I’ve heard rave reviews about this diaper being the Rolls Royce of diapers, and it does hit a lot of good points but not sure if it’s exactly a game changer for our little ones.

First off the quality and feel of the diapers have been the best. I have not used a diaper that is softer and overall better feeling than Coterie so far. No weird smells, no plastics feeling, just something that would feel nice to wear.

Absorption is great, for most messes the diaper is quick to wick up and tends to leave your little one dry. We’ve had some moments where it can struggle a little bit as we’ve had quite a few blow outs or leaks. Probably due to our babies size being right at the limit of weight for the respective size. Do yourself a favor and size up if you think it’s a little too snug or small.

Do I think these are the game changing diapers that will lead to more sleep? Not exactly but maybe for some babies. But I do believe they are a great quality diaper to have. .

All in all, if you can splurge, do it. Try it out and come to your own conclusions.

reviews.title: My child is not a
reviews.content: My child is not a bigger eater at all. To compensate for the lack of food, he drinks ALOT. And my husband and I struggled, STRUGGLED to find a diaper that could keep up with his excessive urination. We were tired of him waking up during the night due to leakage, soiled clothes and soiled bedding. This diaper is awesome! The quality feels completely different from other brands, more luxurious. The extra padding makes it super absorbent and the best part of all, it doesn't fall apart or leaves traces of crystalized cotton fabric on the baby. It stays completely in tact no matter how soiled! I am not one to normally leave reviews on anything, but as a mother who is no longer irritated by broken sleep, and no longer irritated by other brands claiming to have the best overnight diapers, as a mother who understands the frustration I definitely wanted to leave a review to help another mother out there. By the way, baby skin did not react negatively to these diapers which is another plus!

reviews.title: I don’t usually write reviews,
reviews.content: I don’t usually write reviews, but if you are looking for a diaper that is superior to all the rest you can stop your search here! Coterie diapers are soft, all natural, and the MOST absorbent. I can honestly say I use probably one coterie diaper for every 3 other brand diaper. My daughter sleeps through the night and wakes up feeling dry and cozy. I even accidentally washed a coterie diaper that snuck into the laundry, and it did NOT explode! If that’s not a true testament to how well made these diapers are, I don’t know what is! My only complaint is that I didn’t know about these amazing diapers with my first two kids. Totally worth the money, as you wind up using fewer diapers. AND they honor our nation’s heroes by offering a military discount!

reviews.title: Overall love this diaper, how
reviews.content: Overall love this diaper, how absorbent and soft it is. One issue we had been running into is the sizing. Our experience had been as soon as our son reaches >1,5lb of recommended weight per diaper size, we were starting to have blowouts. Such as when we were using NB size as soon as he was closer to 8,5lbs we started to have blowouts almost every time he pooped (although the chart says under 10 lbs). Now we are on size 1 and the same thing happened when he was 10,5-11 we started to have consistent blowouts. I would recommend updating the sizing chart. Our son is 50% percentile in height and weight gain. Hope this helps. We will continue using Coterie, and would recommend it to our friends.

reviews.title: We ended up comparing Coterie
reviews.content:
We ended up comparing Coterie to a few other brands. Here’s how- first, we ordered the diaper box from buy buy baby before she was born. So they send you a package of various brands. We got Coterie, Dyper, Hello Bello, and EcoPea. At that point we had already decided Coterie felt the nicest to the touch.
Then baby girl was born long and skinny (has plumped up nicely now) but had to wear Pampers preemie diapers in the hospital.
Here’s what we found:
The EcoPea are terrible- so cardboard and stiff that it was hard to get them on her. The newborn size didn’t want to bend around her body. We had been using the coterie diapers but I pulled these out as not to waste them and after his first time changing her my husband asked my what happened to the good diapers. Plus we had a urine leak. 
The Pampers were seriously better than the EcoPea. 
The Dyper diapers are OK. There’s no print at all so you will put one on backwards in the middle of the night. They are crinkly compared to Coterie too, not near as soft but probably second best. 
Hello Bello are also OK and less bulky than EcoPea and Dyper but still have a plastic film, more like pampers. Plus the garish design is not my favorite. If I have her dressed in a white or earth toned onesie or dress I don’t want a bright purple and green diaper peeking out. 
I was happy with the Coterie before we decided to try the other brands. Now I realize the leaps and bounds better Coterie is when truly compared. 
Price wise Dyper and EcoPea run similar to Coterie and I would certainly not buy either again. I know there are cheaper diapers out there but this is the single baby item with the most contact with my precious little one. I think it’s entirely reasonable to be very selective about diapers. Yes they are disposable but they are also the one thing your baby will wear every single day. 
Coterie FTW for sure.

reviews.title: Love these diapers! I read
reviews.content: Love these diapers! I read lots of reviews before my daughter was born and decided on these. They have lived up to the hype! My daughter rarely has any issues with diaper rash in these compared to other brands and she’s less fussy overall when they need to be changed. Very few blowouts except when she needs to size up. Only negative is that she still uses many of them and I’d like to be able to have them shipped more frequently. Overall, our family loves them!

reviews.title: Since we started using coterie
reviews.content:
Since we started using coterie diapers we no longer need to use diaper cream all the time which is fantastic since my baby has sensitive skin.

I have two complaints though, we can't use them for over night because they're fully saturated in the morning and my baby's skin is visibly wet. My baby is a boy, always sleeps on his tummy, and sleeps for ~12 hours so I'm sure that all factors into it.

The diapers do run small. My baby is normally a 5 in pampers pure but I had to order a 6 in coterie even though he's 24lbs and should fit in the 5 according to the size chart. We'll have to stop using coterie diapers when he out grows the 6 since that's the biggest size.

reviews.title: We use Coterie diapers because
reviews.content: We use Coterie diapers because our baby has very sensitive skin. She hasn’t had any breakouts since we switched in December 2021 and here we are 6 months later with no complaints. Her pediatrician even wanted to know what we did to help eliminate her breakouts. We told her we switched diapers. She had stated at one of her past appointments that diapers wouldn’t make a difference in preventing her diaper rash, but at her recent appointment she said that we made a good choice in diapers, because I mentioned to her that I did a little research on diapers. I informed her once we switched to Coterie we only use ointment if she has consecutive bowel movements. I informed her that we are also environmentally conscious so using Coterie is a double win for us! Her pediatrician said she would share this info with other parents. We tell all of friends with babies about Coterie and encourage them to make the switch because we are so satisfied with the quality! We low key think our little one thanks us too!

reviews.title: I did a lot of
reviews.content:
I did a lot of research on products before my baby arrived. She’s now 2 months old and I can honestly say that Coterie diapers, while they are more expensive than every other diaper, are completely worth every single penny. 

So yes, they truly are superior to every other diaper and every time I change my daughter, I know her sensitive new baby skin has the best materials and product on her booty. 

Also, we used some Honest Co diapers right away that were gifted (I really contemplated if all of the videos of water being dumped out/absorbed vs Coterie were the real deal), and Coterie makes them look and feel so cheap. Honest Co quite literally pools and leaks, Coterie quickly absorbs.

Soft sizing - Coterie does run a little smaller compared to what they list for lbs!

reviews.title: These diapers are nice, but
reviews.content: These diapers are nice, but they do not keep my baby dry through the night, which is why I bought them. He also had a blow out through the back one night and peed himself out of the side one night (probably my fault). Basically, they are just more money than I would care to spend and they have not performed any better than the Huggies that I normally use.

reviews.title: These diapers are the most
reviews.content: These diapers are the most absorbent, soft diapers I have ever seen! Just because I was curious, I experimented and started pouring some water in a clean diaper to visually see how much it would hold. Needless to say, I was pouring water in for a while and these diapers hold a LOT of liquid! In the end, I’d probably poured about 2 cups of water into the diaper (which is way more than a baby would pee!). These are also the softest diapers I have ever felt. Whenever we need to use an emergency Huggies, I’m always surprised by how much they feel like plastic! Returning to our Coterie diapers once again is such a delight.

reviews.content: We needed disposable diapers for a trip to Paris, as reusable cotton diapers were not an option. We will be using them on our next trip.

reviews.title: We are in love with
reviews.content:
We are in love with Coterie’s diapers! Comparing the material of Coterie to other brands showcases the superior quality of them. 

My sole complaint of Coterie is that the subscription does not come with enough diapers for our baby’s needs. We have to purchase a box of additional diapers at the store to keep us stocked until our next shipment. I hope that Coterie updates their offerings to include customizing amount of diapers per month and/or purchasing additional diapers via their website. 

In conclusion, we recommend the splurge on Coterie diapers based on their superior quality.

reviews.title: Incredible diaper! I accidentally ordered
reviews.content: Incredible diaper! I accidentally ordered a size too big this month and have gotten leaks each night. Overall so soft and truly keep baby dry, by far the best diaper we have tried! My only complaint is delivery; it’s no secret these are costly diapers, you definitely pay for quality and convenience but there is no guarantee you will not run out of diapers month-to-month.

reviews.title: These are super soft and
reviews.content: These are super soft and have great absorbency. Our babe is on the small side and these diapers are the best fit. We say these diapers are like a fancy toilet paper that adults love. We have had some trickiness in trying to figure out when to size up as sometimes it seems like we should but then we do and the diaper is too big for a bit. We have started to use the next size up (if we are in between) as our overnight diapers. Our 6-pack subscription seems to be just right for us, and I love that you can easily adjust frequency as we have sometimes had to do. It’s also easy to get an additional/out of cycle box.

reviews.content: Super absorbent, we've only had 1 blow out. Minimal diaper rash, great quality.

reviews.title: These are the best diapers
reviews.content: These are the best diapers we've ever used. We were out for a few hours and forgot the diaper bag. When I changed her when we got home, the diaper was definitely wet, but her skin was dry! It was amazing. She usually complains as soon as she is even a little wet in other diapers but in Coterie, she never gets fussy (at least not about her diaper!). I also feel great that we are reducing out landfill contribution a little bit!

reviews.title: Love how soft the diapers
reviews.content: Love how soft the diapers are and they move well with my baby. I appreciate knowing that they are made from safe ingredients. I have not had issues with leaking from the diapers. My only complaint is because they do not contain plastics, the outside comes apart fairly easily and my baby loves to pull at the outside of the diaper and rip it apart, but this won’t deter me from using these diapers over other products.

reviews.title: Coterie is the most luxurious
reviews.content: Coterie is the most luxurious diaper you can buy for your baby. It’s worth every single penny because it is by far the most superb quality of diaper I’ve ever seen. After feeling a Coterie diaper, I felt so guilty for having used another brand for the first 4 months of my baby’s life. I was unaware that I could purchase a trial pack so I just went with what was familiar (Honest Company). Boy, was that a mistake! Since using Coterie, my baby never has any redness, we said goodbye to all diaper creams, and he’s never had a blowout. It’s so absorbent that when I change him in the morning, his diaper is full but his skin is clean and dry. A more perfect diaper simply does not exist!

reviews.title: I originally planned on cloth
reviews.content: I originally planned on cloth diapers, and I will switch to them once she grows into them. However, after a difficult birth with a hard recovery and our baby ending up in NICU, having non-toxic disposable diapers has been a life saver. These diapers are soft, truly leak proof, comfortable, and extremely durable. She has not had diaper rash, has only had one leakage due to poor diapering technique, and they fit beautifully. We had no problems with the newborn size irritating her umbilical cord, and they still fit her at 9. 8 pounds. But she doesn't have much of butt. These are pricey, and it was hard to justify the cost, but I am so thankful I did. Her sensitive skin would have become so inflamed with mass market disposable diapers. I'm grateful to the Coterie company for creating such a conscientious and well made disposable diaper. My only thing is I wish every parent had access to diapers like these, regardless of financial status. Every baby/parent deserves these.

reviews.title: I have tried all the
reviews.content: I have tried all the “clean” diaper brands. These are the best! So soft, so absorbent! My baby has sensitive skin and these are the only ones that don’t irritate her skin. I never thought I’d be a diaper a snob, but here I am. One happy mama!

No leaks, no poop explosion clothes changes. Sizes are great. Quality and quantity great. Easy 10/10. Highly recommend. The diapers and wipes may cost a little more, however you will have no extra clothes changes, in turn less laundry, no rashes, in turn no buying expensive rash creams. Worth every penny. Please come out with toddler training underwear.

reviews.title: I held out on buying
reviews.content: I held out on buying expensive diapers for overnight until we consistently had a leaking problem as my son sleeps on his stomach and loves to drink a lot of milk before bed. Kotori has been a game changer. I still stick a Sposie pad inside the front of the diaper but the combination has led to a dry baby all 12 hours + 1-2 hours awake in the morning sometimes if he won’t let me change him. Worth every penny for overnight!

reviews.title: Best diapers ever!! If you’re
reviews.content: Best diapers ever!! If you’re trying to decide whether or not to order them, definitely do it! You will not regret it. My son is a heavy wetter and would leak through regular diapers with one go. With Coterie, we use fewer diapers and have less clean up, saving time and money all the way around. The convenience of having them delivered is awesome and I’m so happy I found them. They are also probably the softest diapers I’ve ever found. 💗

reviews.content: Thank you! 2month old slept an hr longer in coterie and soaking wet/heavy diaper was absolutely dry to touch when changed. Super soft to touch! We love them 🙏🏼🙌🏼

However- the website crashes often, there's no option to select different sized diapers in same order (I ordered a size up because I was worried they might not fit and therefore the diaper looks really bulky and unsightly.

reviews.title: Worth the switch! If you're
reviews.content: Worth the switch! If you're still breastfeeding and your baby is letting loose those liquidity stools, you will probably still have blow outs (or at least we did), but overall I would recommend this diaper to anyone. We turned to Coterie because baby girl was waking up after 12 hours of night sleep with diaper rashes and I was in pain for her. After using Coterie I can honestly say her bum has never looked so good! Definitely will be ordering again. I only gave this a 4 star review because they tell you that the diapers run small, but that they have adjusted their sizing based on people's reviews, so I naively ordered according to their size chart which for us was 19 pounds and a size 3 diaper, but I would seriously suggest ordering a size up. The only plus to diapers such as huggies and pampers is that they have a little extra material in the waist for the chunky babies out there!

reviews.title: Coterie is the absolute best!
reviews.content:
Coterie is the absolute best! I’ve tried pretty much every diaper brand:
Honest: leaks like crazy
Seventh generation: a little too rough on the skin
Millie moon:run crazy big, also no elastic so there’s no “give”
Pampers pure: still gave my kids a rash
Huggies: even the “clean” version still has bleach.
Coterie wins in all categories! Clean, soft, fit well. And when I ordered the wrong size they sent my the new size on them! Amazing!
Super pleased with this brand

reviews.content:

Thanks for a great product and even better service!!!

reviews.content: I chose coterie for a few reasons- the materials used, minimizing leaks and blowouts, and the ease of a subscription delivery. We haven’t had any kind of diaper rash (although we are changing her frequently). I am frustrated by how you cannot order newborn size diapers without size 1 diapers. My baby is tiny, and it is a huge pain to keep having to put in extra orders because I am only receiving half of what I need (and we’ll need to pause our subscription when we get to size 1). If you need lots of nb diapers, the setup is frustrating.

reviews.title: Was skeptical why people were
reviews.content:
Was skeptical why people were so preferential with their diapers… any diaper seemed to work just fine on our newborn. I received a size 1 pack in a sampler of diapers and noticed the difference. Our baby girl was always very quick to let us know she had a wet or soiled diaper and with these she could get through a little more time. I was still in denial but before we sized up to size 2 she started having blow outs and I was worried she would get nappy rash so I thought maybe I’ll order some of those Fancy ones we liked and see if it makes a difference. 
Not only does it make a difference but the auto delivery is extremely convenient and it has amazing reminders to change size or quantities should you need to before an auto delivery.

Recommending to all my friends who have babies.

My baby is big at 3 months and has already sized up to a size 3 (in all brands not just Coterie) I would say they run pretty down the line in terms of size.

reviews.title: We love Coterie diapers! Our
reviews.content:
We love Coterie diapers! Our baby is a blowout queen… she poops in shocking amounts, and other diapers were not able to stand up to the test. She still has the occasional blowout with Coterie, but they’re so minimal (some leakage out of the top, back, or sides) compared to the horrific events of diapers past. With other diapers, too, she got very rashy very easily. Her redness is minimal to non-existent with Coterie. 

These diapers are super soft, too. They’re comfortable for baby, and they can withstand some serious stuff! My husband tested these diapers next to Kirkland diapers by pouring water on each. The Coterie diaper held 12 oz of water with no leaks at all! Kirkland ended up leaking quite a bit around 11 oz. All in all, we’re very happy with Coterie!

reviews.title: We actually get to sleep
reviews.content:
We actually get to sleep through the night now! 

We use cloth diapers, and though they’re wonderful, even with added absorbing material added for night time they just weren’t cutting it. So we were searching for either a more absorbent cloth option or a disposable to use for night time only. 

Coterie diapers have been great. We haven’t changed a diaper in the middle of the night since we started using them and we were doing it every night before. They come out heavy and soaked in the morning but without leaks. We still use cloth during the day, but this has restored our sleep in a big way.

She appears to be extremely comfortable, they’re incredibly soft and don’t feel like plastic. She’s very mobile in them, they’re not bulky and we’ve had less blow outs which makes mommy very pleased.

We definitely noticed she was sleeping more as soon as we put the Coteries on her at night and not very fussy even when she did wake up. She’s doing 5+ hour stretches at a time at night now - we definitely think she’ll be sleeping through the night before we know it and the Coterie diapers I think will be part of the reason why. I will definitely continue to purchase these - they are pricier then regular diapers but in my opinion you can’t put a price on a happier baby and more sleep at night. Very happy I discovered these!

reviews.title: These diapers are amazing! They
reviews.content: These diapers are amazing! They have been our go to diapers since day one. Our son can sleep through the night without needing a change and they stay extremely dry. The material is so soft and comfy. Once star off because you have to buy a one month supply no matter what, which makes no sense. If we just need a few more, we have to buy a whole months supply. Which means he'll outgrow them before using another entire months worth. It's incredibly wasteful for a company that seems to care about being green. But I suppose that's by design so they can get more money from you. Please sell them in a single sleeve of 25 or something in addition to the month supply!

reviews.content: I love these diapers! The NB size fits my 7 pound newborn perfectly. I wish I could order only NB sizing. . . the website makes split the order b/t NB and size 1. I have a mountain of size 1s waiting for us while I have to keep ordering NBs during these first weeks. Maybe I'll be glad for the stockpile of size 1s later down the road. Anyways, as a new mom I don't have much to compare to. Friends swear by these diapers - one mom even said her baby has too flat of a butt and kept getting blowouts with other brands. We use Pampers and Coterie - Coterie is a much thicker diaper and it does a great job pulling the mess of a #1 and #2 away from my baby's skin. The price is definitely high - my hope is that as this brand scales, they'll pass on some savings to their customers

reviews.title: I love Coterie’s diapers on
reviews.content: I love Coterie’s diapers on my baby! We bought a size 2, and the quality is wonderful on my baby’s bum. He’s technically a 1 month old newborn, but he’s 13lbs and it fits him perfectly. I don’t have to worry about leaks or how tight it is around his legs. The material is so soft and absorbent that I don’t have to worry too much about his skin being irritated. It does cost a bit, but your babies bums will thank you for going the extra mile!

reviews.title: I was skeptical. Our little
reviews.content:
I was skeptical. Our little guy is only 7 weeks old, and we were prepared for having to wake up every few hours with a newborn, but I thought. . . why not? Let's see. Even if this box of diapers only buys us an hour per sleep cycle it will be worth the cost. We planned to only use them at night to make them stretch and need to buy them less frequently. We would cancel if we didn't see a difference.

Yeah. . . we use them OFTEN during the day, as well as every night. I find myself reaching for Coteries whenever we will be out of the house! (we were gifted other diaper brands in varying sizes, which we us in between).

There is SUCH a difference, and we don't need to change him at every waking! And last night my 7 week old slept for 11 hours with only one waking!!!!!

I don't know how much of it is the diapers or just his temperament, but before we bough these he woke up every 3 hours. I will not be cancelling my subscription!

Also, I needed to swap to a different size and their customer service (which they do via text, and is awesome) was excellent!

reviews.content: They are super soft, but my newborn keeps leaking right through them. Yesterday we went through 5 outfits. We have noticed when switching from other diapers that may have caused a diaper rash, the coterie ones make it disappear.

reviews.title: These are by far the
reviews.content: These are by far the best diapers! We tried multiple brands, including other high end diapers. However, our baby had a consistent rash for months, which meant needing to change her frequently and use an insane amount of diaper paste at each change. With coterie our daughter hasn’t even had the slightest of rashes even with less frequent diaper changes and only using paste before bedtime. The diapers may be more expensive than most brands, but between using less of them per day and not needing to use expensive paste each change, we’re definitely saving money! We went from about 10 changes a day down to 4. Also, even if it were costing more, it would be completely worth it because my daughters months long diaper rash is completely gone. She had a rash from about 3 months to 6 months. During this time we sought advice from her pediatrician, tried different creams, and tried a few other brands of diapers but nothing worked. We then switched to coterie at 6 months and she hasn’t had a single rash since and she’s 8. 5 months old! The diapers are so soft and well made that I can totally see how they’d be our only solution!

reviews.content:

Even when they’re super full of pee, the inside doesn’t feel wet and my son’s skin feels dry when I take the diaper off. Before I started using Coterie (wipes and diapers), my son got a horrible diaper rash but we haven’t had that issue since switching to coterie!

These diapers also have kept in MASSIVE mushy poops that really should have been a blowout. We’ve only had two blowouts thus far, and one of which was when we should have started to size up to size 2. 

We love Coterie wipes and diapers and will continue to re-order!!

reviews.title: When I was pregnant with
reviews.content:
When I was pregnant with baby #3 I found coterie and instantly thought I needed to give them a try. Initially I was looking at the ingredients without any expectation as to feel or quality because my 2 girls have been allergic to Pampers, LUVS, honest, Kirkland, Up&Up…You name it and Huggies was the only diaper that worked for us for babies 1&2. I knew there had to be something better. 

When coterie diapers arrived I was so impressed, they feel like a mini cloud. In comparison with our special delivery and little snugglers, they really felt amazing and who doesnt want to feel amazing. It made me think of menstrual pads so mommies on the fence, dont be. Coterie is super soft and has not caused any issues with my little one.

We tried different diapers this time too and we prefer coterie. Additionally customer support and text service are superb. I can just text and less than 5 min later, our order is placed. 

I appreciate the commitment of this company to bring families better products and helping those in need as well. Will continue supporting coterie until we stop diapering.

Another great advantage is not having to haul a giant box of diapers through costco or ever worrying about running out since I always have my supply delivered right on time. 

Yes, my baby is sleeping longer at night. 

Also, I love the minimal design- no weird patterns peeking through my baby's cute clothes.

reviews.title: These diapers have been game
reviews.content: These diapers have been game changer for my baby. I switched from pampers to coterie couple weeks back. My 4 week old newborn refused to stay in a wet diaper and her sensitive skin would get red from the elastic of the diaper. BUT once we moved to coterie, she really doesn’t feel uncomfortable in a wet diaper because it truly absorbs liquid much more. These diapers are soft and also, we’ve been having much fewer blowouts. In summary - a winner!

reviews.title: The absorbency of these diapers
reviews.content: The absorbency of these diapers make it worth every penny. My baby has been sleeping through the night without any fussing and when she wakes up in the morning she’s so well rested and in such a good mood. My husband is pretty squeamish when it comes to the strong scent from poopy diapers but so far, he has yet to complain. You have to get super close to even notice The baby pooped. It’s really incredible. With the last brand we used, you’d be able to smell that she pooped just by walking in the room. Also, the texture of these diapers is amazing. They are thick, absorbent, and so soft! I love the look of the clean white diaper as well. Knowing that it’s also free or all those bad chemicals makes me relieved. Definitely worth the purchase!

reviews.title: I’ve tried a variety of
reviews.content: I’ve tried a variety of Scandinavian Bambo, American Pampers and Huggies (regular and special delivery) and Japanese Moony and Merries brands for our newborn. Moony are very nice but nothing comes close to Coterie!!! These are our favorite diapers now! Coterie diapers are beautifully made with a minimal design and sit higher on the babies waist than most other brands. Most importantly they are so absorbent and my baby stays dry through the night. we’ve yet to have a single leak or blow out in these! I absolutely love Coterie and will be getting a subscription of these magical things going forward.

reviews.title: I love these diapers! They
reviews.content:
I love these diapers! They absorb very well. We knew from the beginning that these were the best choice. When baby was newborn, we ran out of Coterie and had to use the Pampers that we were sent home with. And baby woke up so many times uncomfortable because the diaper had to be changed. 

Sizing maybe a bit off. because as you size up the length gets bigger but width stays the same, or maybe my baby just has a bigger bottom. idk… But it didn’t fit quite well and we had a few blowouts because of that. But, still worth using.

Their customer service is horrible. Yes, they respond promptly to the text for delivery. But, when you have a question and send to their email, it takes a month for them to respond. They said they’re a small crew, but still that’s irresponsible. If you can’t respond to emails in a timely manner, then list that as an expectation on your website. Especially since there’s no phone number to call and talk to someone.
