reviews.title: These are absolutely the best
reviews.content:
These are absolutely the best diapers on the market, as evidenced by the fact that we voluntarily pay *way more* than any other diaper I know of (and have done so since our babe was a newborn). If you can afford the luxury, this should be your only choice. 

Things to note: The newborn dipes are very small (smaller than some other brands) and were perfect for the first few weeks. Also, Coterie’s customer service is outstanding. My mother in law purchased the wrong size as a gift and rather than take them back during COVID, they told her to donate the smaller ones and credited her the amount to purchase the right size. Almost $100! We were really impressed by that kind of integrity.

reviews.title: The material in this diaper
reviews.content: The material in this diaper is really good. It feels soft and has great quality. I use size 5 overnight and bought these a size 5 as well, but it’s been a mess. My baby is having incidents even earlier in the night, it doesn’t seem the diaper is full so i guess it’s too big on her and just doesn’t fit right. These diapers are too expensive to try and buy a size down and see if they work better so for now I’ve stopped using them and will give them a try later on.

reviews.title: Love the plain white design,
reviews.content:
Love the plain white design, soft material, and extra large wings. The elastic back is a bonus that I feel is mandatory on diapers - and the wipes are amazing. 
The only downside other than the expense is the sizing for NB & size 1. The leg hole to stomach width ratio is off. Newborns tend to have very skinny legs and large stomachs, so the leg holes should be a bit smaller with a little more give in the stomach. Other than that, the claim of absorbancy may be a little far fetched for a NB. I don't know how anyone gets these diapers to hold for more than 3-4hrs at the 1-2hr newborn feeding stage we are in currently. I feel like these diapers can only hold 2-3hrs worth of pee before it leads to a blowout or pee-through. 
Overall, still amazing diapers and wipes! I am a forever customer long as the product continues to provide the quality and rash free protection it currently does!!

reviews.title: The fit is a little
reviews.content: The fit is a little on the small side- we might grow out of this size before we use even half of the diapers, super soft and I love how they look.

reviews.content: Coterie claims that they don’t need an “overnight” version of their diaper because the material is so absorbent. It’s been the third time now that my baby had a leak overnight using Coterie compared to another leading brand. So basically I can only use Coterie during the daytime and I have to buy another brand’s diaper for overnight, which is really annoying because it was one of the main reasons I wanted to switch over to Coterie in the first place. Womp womp…

reviews.title: These are the absolute best
reviews.content: These are the absolute best diapers on the market. We tried several different brands including pampers, Huggies, Honest, and Hello Bello, but coterie outshines all of them. My baby got a rash at only a week old because of other diapers that just didn’t keep the moisture off him, even with very frequent changes. We struggled to get rid of this for a couple weeks when I finally ordered coterie diapers, and within a few days of using them, his rash went away. They fit so well, and they prevent blowouts better than any other diaper. They are also the softest diapers, and we always get asked by nurses etc. what kind of diapers they are! I will never use any other brand from here on out. My husband didn’t understand the importance of a good diaper and thought any brand would do, but he is now a coterie lover too and prefers them for our baby. They truly are the best!

reviews.content:
I'm absolutely loving our Coterie diapers. I was hesitant because of the price and the need to get a full months' supply at once but I am so happy I finally pulled the trigger and got them!

They're definitely softer than the other brands of disposable diapers I've tried and they are certainly heavy duty. I feel like they're doing a great job in terms of absorbency and fit. My little one is on the stocky side, and finding a diaper that fits him right is difficult. I'm so happy to report these fit him better than any of the other brands. 

I'm beyond happy with the quality of the diapers and will continue to purchase them! The only thing I haven't mastered yet is the frequency so I can sign up for the monthly subscription.

reviews.title: Best diapers we have ever
reviews.content: Best diapers we have ever had! Super absorbent, zero blowouts, and our 2-month old has still never had diaper rash even though we are changing less frequently then with our first born. While you definitely pay a premium for these diapers, you use less, which is both good for your pocket and the planet (since a 100% biodegradable diaper doesn’t actually exist!). At the end of the day, the cost is competitive to comparable, less quality diapers. It’ is also nice to know that some portion of the cost is going towards technology to reduce the footprint of diapers, which is badly needed. On a side note, it would be nice if Coterie clearly highlighted exactly what type of technologies they are supporting with some of there profits.

reviews.title: We’ve had a lot of
reviews.content: We’ve had a lot of difficulty with diapers leaking, and then a fungal rash that just wouldn’t go away. I got these as a last resort at the recommendation of my sister and have been very impressed. We’ve stopped using creams on the rash and it is clearing up. We haven’t had a single leak or blow out. In total transparency we still use another brand for overnights, but we could probably start using these. We also had issues with other “all natural” wipes causing irritation. These wipes are soft and substantial for wiping up #2. Obviously, have to mention the convenience factor of getting them delivered to your door. Overall, very pleased and don’t mind paying a little more for this quality!

reviews.title: We are obsessed with these
reviews.content:
We are obsessed with these diapers. So soft, they fit great, and we haven’t had a single blow out in 8 weeks. They also LOOK nice, which sounds trivial but actually matters when you are looking at something every single diaper change. 

Best of all, the absorbency is unreal. The surface of these diapers stays dry no matter how “heavy” the diaper is (parents, you know what I mean!). I love knowing that even overnight or for long stretches, my baby is totally dry. Amazing! We’ll never use a different diaper.

reviews.title: we use primarily cloth diapers
reviews.content: we use primarily cloth diapers to be eco friendly. . . we got these for overnights and long day outings. . . WOW. just wow. they hold so much liquid and keep your baby's skin dry, we haven't had one blowout yet and the quality is unparalleled. we were also sold on the fact that they're acknowledging disposable diapers contribute to landfill waste and they're proactively trying to be part of the solution. i can't imagine any diaper even comparing to these. make the switch, you won't regret it!

reviews.title: Picking a diaper is such
reviews.content:
Picking a diaper is such a big decision, so how do you choose?
Well, Coterie was a no brainer! First, let’s talk coverage. The diaper covers my little Wilder, perfectly! Blow-outs are far and few between because the absorbency in these diapers is insane! He can go all night long without even waking for a change because these diapers keep him completely dry! Diaper rash? Never! He used to get such horrid diaper rash in the honest diapers. We used Cod Liver oil and switched to Coterie and it was the best diapering decision I’ve ever made and I stand proudly by it! 
What about fit?
These diapers grow with my peanut. We are currently 16 lbs and in size 2. I presume he will be in this size for a month or a little more. It’s super easy to know when you need to size-up and the sizes are standard and true to the weight limit they claim.
Switch to Coterie. Save yourself the time you waste while trying to find the perfect diaper, and order now. You’ll thank me later ;)

reviews.title: I wavered between giving these
reviews.content:
I wavered between giving these diapers 3 and 4 stars.

Pros:
- Clean ingredients
- Super soft
- Plain white design

Cons:
- The wetness indicator is so faint that you can barely see it. Its impossible to see if the diaper is wet without shining a flashlight on it or turning the lights on bright. We use them during the day, but these are advertised as being so great for night time, so that was a disappointment. I realize that if your baby sleeps through the night, then the indicator doesn't matter, but every baby doesn't sleep 12 hours so it is always light out.
- You have to buy 6 packs at once and you can't order multiple sizes, so if you pick the wrong size you're out of luck.
- The sizing advice on the website is way off. The diapers that arrived were enormous. She eventually grew into them, but it was annoying (per my prior point) to have to store a huge box of diapers because we couldn't order two sizes or just one pack to assess the proper size. Also, the website has all this language about assessing proper fit by looking at things other than weight, but the size guide only provides weight guidance. . . not super helpful.

reviews.title: Coterie diapers are our absolute
reviews.content: Coterie diapers are our absolute favorite! And we’ve tried a ton of different brands. reviews.title: So far we are very
reviews.content: So far we are very pleased! I love that they feel softer than other brands, and leave fewer 'wrinkles' and dents on her skin. They are a VERY good fit for her tall & lean body size. They do a better job of holding in blowouts than all the other brands we've tried, which is the most important thing to us. I don't think these diapers are the best at holding in wetness for overnight wear compared to others -- our baby sleeps 10 hours straight (thankfully) and her skin feels kind of wet in the morning. Overall, I give Coterie a 9/10! We'll keep ordering!

reviews.title: First let me say overall
reviews.content:
First let me say overall I LOVE Coterie diapers!! They are by far the softest diaper I’ve ever felt! And I love the fact that they don’t smell like perfume or chemicals like other diapers do!! Unfortunately I do find myself having to change my daughter (9 months old) a bit more often than other brands. Also, the diaper itself doesn’t have much “give” or stretch! And the sizing seems to be a tad off! The diapers are a bit on the smaller side, and my daughter is TINY! 5th percentile for weight 2nd for height. Size 3 diapers of other brands are very roomy on her! However, size 3 of Coterie diapers seems VERYY snug and basically like I should have gotten size 4 instead! I only used like 4 diapers from my pack and I’m so disappointed because they really are just too snug! Which leads go not only leaks but diaper lines on my daughter! And these diapers are a bit pricey so I feel like I wasted money since I’m stuck with these size 3’s since the pack is open. :/ 
All in all I love the diaper just real words of advice SIZE UP! Especially* if the current size your baby is in with other brands is getting snug!

reviews.title: One of my favorite diapers
reviews.content: These are the softest of all the diapers I’ve tried, and it’s been a couple dozen. The leg fringe is long and the elastic is a really good fit. They absorb better than any of the other eco brands I tried and don’t get as puffy as even the conventional brands. My son is 12. 5lbs now and we’re working on using up the last of our size 1’s, but he could easily wear size two and has had a few blowouts from diapers I haven’t caught in time. My biggest design changes I would make would be a pocket back waistband and wider wetness indicator stripes. It can be tricky to see the color change during dimly lit middle of the night checks with how thin the stripes are and how fuzzy the diapers are. I wish I could order these with my diaper discount on amazon. After it runs out if I can afford it I will be switching to these. Hopefully they’ll be available for subscribe and save by then because they’re excellent quality and I’ve been very impressed.

reviews.title: Love these diapers so much more than other big disposable brands!
reviews.content: LOVE these diapers! They are true to size, look great, and feel great. They do absorb a lot. What I liked most is that the liquid gets dispersed evenly throughout the diaper. Other top brand diapers pool the liquid in either the front or back, causing the diaper to not last as long. Another huge difference is that when full, other diapers get COLD and you can just feel a huge lump of cold, congealed gel where the liquid was absorbed. Coterie diapers do not do this. They’re really more like cloth diapers, in all the right ways!

reviews.title: Definitely runs a bit small.
reviews.content: Definitely runs a bit small. These size 2 are the size of Dyper brand size 1. However, these are beautifully made and seem to offer lots of comfort and absorbency. The design detail is really well crafted.

reviews.title: good, may be on par with Pamper Sensitive
reviews.content: I like these diapers because they are extremely soft for diapers (we've used Honest brand, Thrive Brand, Pampers swaddlers, Pampers sensitive). We bought these using a promo code and because our baby had diaper rash not on the bum but on the front side of his body so we needed to rotate diapers and this brand was one we chose. His diaper rash healed up, can't say it was because of this alone or the 2 other diaper brands we had in rotation, or the airing out or the desitin. He definitely sleeps longer through night but again, can't say if that's because he's getting older. If you can get on discount, definitely try it if you are on fence. I would order again.

The design was simple and elegant. The size was perfect she fit it well. It was a good diaper. I guess I didn’t have the same experience as a lot of reviews on here. My 13 month old wore it for a week. She experienced a lot of diaper rashes and it left her skin visibly wet. 
We found another brand that worked nicely for her. We were sad this one did not. But what can I say? After having 3 kids they are ALL so different. 
We did however LOVE the experience in the purchase and because we live in Hawaii the mail usually takes forever, these diapers came in 2 days. Overall this company is amazing and the easy of transaction makes me sad that this isn’t her diaper.

reviews.title: Like a cloud for your baby bum
reviews.content: Love these! They are really so soft inside and out. I wasn’t sure if they would live up to the hype, but they do. They are more expensive than pampers pure, but seem to be worth it so far. They do NOT leak overnight, which is what I typically use these for since they are pricey. They do not break my baby out, which has been an issue in the past. To go 12hrs at night in one diaper, and have her bum be clean and happy is the best! I can see myself buying these exclusively for overnight diapers. I like that they are plain white, and don’t show patterns through light colored clothing. Also, they have a wetness indicator (a must) that’s more subtle but still effective. I have to say, I’m a fan. They are true to size and size 3 fits my 18. 5 lb. baby so well.

reviews.title: The ultimate diaper
reviews.content:
As we all know, Form Follows Function. 

First off, these diapers are absorbent, cozy soft, and I’ve had no skin reactions or blow outs. 

From the aesthetic side, these are exactly what I’ve always wanted in a diaper. Simple, soft white. No garish characters. Just a perfectly timeless and healthy tasteful look, which means there’s no patterns showing through light clothes. 

A friend was searching for this exact same unicorn breed of diaper and I directed her towards Coterie. 

The *only* thing that makes me hesitate to make them my one-and-only forever diaper is the cost. When you are a young family with two kids in diapers, the extra expense ( which is literally thrown away), is harder to justify. 

Glad I tried them though:)
